de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking

Class ClientConnectionManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking.ClientConnectionManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientListener, UnexpectedClientListener

    class ClientConnectionManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientListener, UnexpectedClientListener
    The client connection manager handles the expected client state (sensor speeds, button config etc), as well as the ClientConnection instances used to allow communication with the clients.

    Configuration functions include:

    • addButton(String, int)
    • setButtonLayout(String)
    • setSensorSpeed(SensorType, SetSensorSpeed.SensorSpeed)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String> mButtonMap
      list of buttons that should be displayed on all clients
      private java.lang.String mButtonXML
      This string is either null or the current description of the button layout.
      private java.util.List<ClientConnection> mClientConnections
      This is the list of all currently bound clients.
      private ClientListener mClientListener
      This is listener is used to notify of timeouts
      private ClientLossListener mClientLossListener
      This interface must be called if a client is lost to allow the AbstractPsychicServer to react
      private OnCommandListener mCommandListener
      Who to notify about commands
      private NetworkDataSink mDataSink
      the data sink where all data produced by the clients is put into
      private ExceptionListener mExceptionListener
      Who to notify about unhandleable exceptions
      private java.util.Set<SensorType> mRequiredSensors
      Sensors required on the android devices
      private java.util.EnumMap<SensorType,SetSensorSpeed.SensorSpeed> mSensorSpeeds
      Store requested speeds for all data sinks
      private java.lang.String mServerName
      Name of the server as displayed to discovery clients

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClientConnectionManager

        ClientConnectionManager(java.lang.String serverName,
                        ExceptionListener exceptionListener,
                        OnCommandListener commandListener,
                        ClientListener clientListener,
                        NetworkDataSink dataSink,
                        ClientLossListener clientLossListener)
        Create a new ClientConnectionManager
        Parameters:
        serverName - how the server is called
        exceptionListener - what should be called if an exception occurs in managed code
        commandListener - who should be notified of commands
        clientListener - who should be notified of client events
        dataSink - who should get all the data

    • Method Detail

      • getUnboundHandler

        ClientConnection getUnboundHandler()
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new correctly initialized unbound handler
        Returns:
        an unbound handler that must be added using addHandler(ClientConnection) to make it part of the clients managed by this ClientConnectionManager
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the handler could not be initialized

        void addHandler(ClientConnection handler)
         throws java.io.IOException
        Add a new handler to the list of bound handlers and configure the client
        Parameters:
        handler - a bound handler
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the client could not be configured

      • closeAll

        void closeAll()
        Close all client connections

      • getClientHandler

        ClientConnection getClientHandler(java.net.InetAddress address)
        This function find the connection handler that is managing a certain client, which is identified only by his address
        Parameters:
        address - the address of the client that should be found
        Returns:
        null if no matching handler was found, or the handler.

      • addButton

        void addButton(java.lang.String name,
               int id)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Add a button to be displayed on the clients clears XMLLayout
        Parameters:
        name - text to be displayed on the button
        id - id of the button. ids below zero are reserved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the required command could not be sent to all clients

           throws java.io.IOException
        Remove a button from the clients clears XMLLayout

        Throws:

      • setButtonLayout

        void setButtonLayout(@Nullable
                     java.lang.String xml)
              throws java.io.IOException
        sets mButtonXML to an incoming XML-String
        Parameters:
        xml - valid android XML layout using only linear layout and button if string is null ButtonMap will be used
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the required command could not be sent to all clients

      • clearButtons

        public void clearButtons()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Remove all buttons added. Clears both buttons added using addButton(String, int) and layouts created using setButtonLayout(String).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the required command could not be sent to all clients

      • setSensorSpeed

        void setSensorSpeed(SensorType sensor,
                    SetSensorSpeed.SensorSpeed speed)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Change the speed of a sensor. The default speed is the GAME speed.
        Parameters:
        sensor - the sensor to change
        speed - the speed to use for sensor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the required command could not be sent to all clients

        Parameters:
        client - the client that should be found
        Returns:
        null if no matching handler was found, or the handler.

      • closeAndSignalClient

        boolean closeAndSignalClient(NetworkDevice client)
        Close the ClientConnection handling a client
        Parameters:
        client - the NetworkDevice that is no longer required
        Returns:
        true if the client was found

      • updateButtons

        private void updateButtons()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Force each client to update his buttons chooses between ClientConnection.updateButtons(String) and ClientConnection.updateButtons(Map) if mButtonXML is given, it is preferred over [mButtonMap
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the update command could not be sent to a client

                         throws java.io.IOException
        Force each client to update the sensor speeds
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an update command could not be sent

                                java.lang.String title,
                                java.lang.String content)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Send a notification to all known devices
        Parameters:
        id - notification id. must be unique on all devices
        title - the notification title
        content - the notification content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a device could not be requested to display the notification

        Force each client to update his required sensors
        Parameters:
        requiredSensors - a set of sensors that each client must enable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the required command could not be sent to all clients

                            SensorType sensor)
        Retrieve the sensor range of a sensor on a device
        Parameters:

        sensor - the sensor
        Returns:
        the range of the sensor, see android docs

      • getSensorMaximumRange

        java.util.HashMap<NetworkDevice,java.lang.Float> getSensorMaximumRange(SensorType sensor)
        Retrieve the sensor range of a sensor on all connected devices
        Parameters:
        sensor - the sensor of which the maximum range is required
        Returns:
        a mapping from NetworkDevice to the float range
